ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
`doit` is a task management & automation tool.

`doit` comes from the idea of bringing the power of build-tools to execute
any kind of **task**

`doit` is a modern open-source build-tool written in python designed to be
simple to use and flexible to deal with complex work-flows.

It is specially suitable for building and managing custom work-flows where
there is no out-of-the-box solution available.

`doit` has been successfully used on: systems test/integration automation,
scientific computational pipelines, content generation, configuration
management, etc."

`doit` is a task management & automation tool.

`doit` comes from the idea of bringing the power of build-tools to execute
any kind of **task**

`doit` is a modern open-source build-tool written in python designed to be
simple to use and flexible to deal with complex work-flows.

It is specially suitable for building and managing custom work-flows where
there is no out-of-the-box solution available.

`doit` has been successfully used on: systems test/integration automation,
scientific computational pipelines, content generation, configuration
management, etc."

name: doit
raw_meta_yaml:
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://raw.githubusercontent.com/prefix-dev/recipe-format/main/schema.json
schema_version: 1

context:
  version: "0.37.0"
  python_check_max: "3.14"

recipe:
  name: doit
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/d/doit/doit-${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: d3c72e0e46a8fa1ddabea8f830762402dee090caf33c30c2295ac7010db8f09c

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python

outputs:
  - package:
      name: doit
    build:
      noarch: python
      script:
        - ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation --disable-pip-version-check
      python:
        entry_points:
          - doit = doit.__main__:main
    requirements:
      host:
        - pip
        - python ${{ python_min }}.*
        - setuptools >=68.0
      run:
        - python >=${{ python_min }}
    tests:
      - python:
          imports: doit
          pip_check: true
          python_version:
            - ${{ python_check_max }}.*
            - ${{ python_min }}.*
      - requirements:
          run:
            - python ${{ python_min }}.*
        script:
          - doit --version
          - doit --help

  - package:
      name: doit-with-cloudpickle
    build:
      noarch: generic
    requirements:
      run:
        - ${{ pin_subpackage("doit", exact=True) }}
        - cloudpickle
    tests:
      - python:
          imports: doit
          pip_check: true
          python_version:
            - ${{ python_check_max }}.*
            - ${{ python_min }}.*
    about:
      summary: doit - Automation Tool (with cloudpickle)

  - package:
      name: doit-with-toml
    build:
      noarch: generic
    requirements:
      run:
        - ${{ pin_subpackage("doit", exact=True) }}
        - tomli
    tests:
      - python:
          imports: doit
          pip_check: true
          python_version:
            - ${{ python_check_max }}.*
            - ${{ python_min }}.*
    about:
      summary: doit - Automation Tool (with toml config)

  - package:
      name: doit-with-all
    build:
      noarch: generic
    requirements:
      run:
        - ${{ pin_subpackage("doit-with-toml", exact=True) }}
        - ${{ pin_subpackage("doit-with-cloudpickle", exact=True) }}
    tests:
      - python:
          imports: doit
          pip_check: true
          python_version:
            - ${{ python_check_max }}.*
            - ${{ python_min }}.*
      - files:
          source:
            - tests/
        requirements:
          run:
            - pytest-cov
            - python ${{ python_min }}.*
        script:
          file: run_doit_suite.py
    about:
      summary: doit - Automation Tool (with all extras)

about:
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: doit - Automation Tool
  description: |
    `doit` is a task management & automation tool.

    `doit` comes from the idea of bringing the power of build-tools to execute
    any kind of **task**

    `doit` is a modern open-source build-tool written in python designed to be
    simple to use and flexible to deal with complex work-flows.

    It is specially suitable for building and managing custom work-flows where
    there is no out-of-the-box solution available.

    `doit` has been successfully used on: systems test/integration automation,
    scientific computational pipelines, content generation, configuration
    management, etc."
  homepage: https://pypi.org/project/doit
  repository: https://github.com/pydoit/doit
  documentation: https://pydoit.org/contents.html

extra:
  feedstock-name: doit
  recipe-maintainers:
    - pbronez
    - bollwyvl
